New Records: Lionel Messi is set to break the record for most appearances at Copa America, surpassing the current joint record held by Sergio Livingstone.
Messi could become the first player from Argentina to play at a seventh edition of South America's most prestigious continental tournament.

Messi will become the all-time leading goalscorer at the Copa America if he scores five goals at this summer's tournament, surpassing the current record held jointly by Argentina's Norberto Mendez and Brazil's Zizinho.
Messi can break the record for most goals in a single Copa America tournament if he scores 10 goals or more.
Messi will join a group of just 10 players to score a hat-trick at two different tournaments if he repeats his feat at this summer's Copa America.

Messi needs to have a stellar 2024 Copa America in front of goal and hope that Cristiano Ronaldo fails to live up to the hype at Euro 2024 if he wishes to hold the record for the most goal contributions by a single player in international football history.
Messi could become the first player in Copa America history to win the POTT award three times this summer and the first ever to win the award in consecutive tournaments.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lionel Messi is set to lead Copa America holders Argentina at this summer's tournament held in the United States.
Messi has already excelled at club level with Inter Miami, scoring 25 goals and registering 16 assists in 29 appearances across all competitions, breaking a plethora of records in the process.
Others: The 2024 Copa America will represent Messi's last dance on the international stage, or so it remains to be seen.
Messi will be keen to make his mark in the States, where he has already excelled at club level with Inter Miami.
